content: Write a sonnet about autumn, using only words that start with 'a'.

Autumn's arrival announces air aglow,
Amidst amber apples abundantly arrayed.
Aromatic aromas ascend, an offering,
As azure skies appear above, unobscured.

Autumnal arrays adorn all around,
Ample acorns accumulate at avenue's edge.
Awe-inspiring, this annual routine found,
Attracting attention, absorbing, impressive.

An artist's array, autumnal attire,
Adorned with auburn, amethyst, and apricot.
An ephemeral artistry, rare and entire,
A spectacle to admire, appreciating it spot.

Ah, autumn, an aesthetic, absolute,
An annual affair, always awe-inspiring, no doubt.
